intro: Stipella nitens, commonly known as the silverleaf stipple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Stipella nitens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
